abstract: Chinese social media were filled with reports on Wednesday that Wang Lijun, one of China's most famous crime fighters, had tried to defect to the United States, Ian Johnson reports from Beijing. Mr. Wang, a one-time rising star in the western megacity of Chongqing where he is deputy mayor overseeing public security and a 52-year-old martial arts practitioner, earned a reputation for busting gangs in the city of 29 million, helping to put its Communist Party chief, Bo Xilai, on the short list for the powerful Standing Committee of the Communist Party's Politburo. Read what all this means for Mr. Bo's chances as China's political season gets underway »

headline.main: Chinese Social Media Abuzz Over Fate of Crime-Fighting Politician
